item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, April 27, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Read the Obits (121 points | 37 comments)
2. Did 5G Kill the IMSI Catcher? (100 points | 39 comments)
3. Walmart plans EV Charging network which will blanket the US within a few years (71 points | 51 comments)
4. Libogc (Wii homebrew library) discovered to contain code stolen from RTEMS (100 points | 45 comments)
5. Reverse Geocoding Is Hard (129 points | 65 comments)
6. Show HN: I created snapDOM to capture DOM nodes as images with exceptional speed (58 points | 26 comments)
7. Show HN: Daily Jailbreak – Prompt Engineer's Wordle (27 points | 18 comments)
8. OpenBSD 7.7 Released (91 points | 10 comments)
9. Shardines: SQLite3 Database-per-Tenant with ActiveRecord (169 points | 53 comments)
10. Unlocking Ractors: Object_id (30 points | discuss)
11. The Coming Knowledge-Work Supply-Chain Crisis (49 points | 19 comments)
12. TmuxAI: AI-Powered, Non-Intrusive Terminal Assistant (68 points | 18 comments)
13. Extend (YC W23) is hiring engineers to build LLM document processing ( | hide)
14. Watching 03 Model Sweat over a Paul Morphy Mate-in-2 (38 points | 19 comments)
15. Business co-founders in tech startups are less valuable than they think (6 points | 1 comment)
16. Show HN: A Common Lisp implementation in development, supports ASDF (59 points | 29 comments)
17. Show HN: Remote-Controlled IKEA Deathstar Lamp (237 points | 49 comments)
18. Mesmerizing Interlocking Geometric Patterns Produced with Japanese Woodworking (93 points | 16 comments)
19. How NASA Is Using Graph Technology and LLMs to Build a People Knowledge Graph (75 points | 17 comments)
20. Calibrations Have a Context-Collapse Problem (24 points | 4 comments)
21. How to program a text adventure in C (203 points | 38 comments)
22. Open-source interactive C tutorial in the browser (217 points | 41 comments)
23. Wikipedia: Database Download (179 points | 84 comments)
24. DMCA Notices Can Silence Critics but Complaints by the Public Put All at Risk (26 points | discuss)
25. Found a simple tool for database modeling: dbdiagram.io (208 points | 59 comments)
26. Icônes (257 points | 34 comments)
27. Bare metal printf – C standard library without OS (207 points | 71 comments)
28. MIT Committee Report on the Changing Nature of Information (1983) [pdf] (15 points | 3 comments)
29. We're building a dystopia just to make people click on ads [video] (196 points | 181 comments)
30. NASA's Lucy Spacecraft Completes Asteroid Donaldjohanson Flyby (22 points | 2 comments)
